channel.title: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!

item.title: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!
item.dc:creator: @Nexus1 Nexus_
item.description:
@Nexus1 wrote:

Its better server sided, like coon said. Although client sided wouldn’t be too bad… just much harder.

[quote=“the elve age, post:7, topic:317262”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=413805.msg3092091#msg3092091 date=1262979998]
Your not adding them, your just getting the client to load them, not doing much here at all…
[/quote][/quote]
I C U LIEK POWST COWNT

Read full topic
item.source: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!

item.title: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“chippeh, post:11, topic:317262”]Ur so awesome your explanation is crap. (sorry to say)

This will do nothing unless you can trigger these server sided… DUR?[/quote]
Actually server sided is easy. DUR?

write.out(playerRights) Or out.write(playerRights) I have not worked with a server in a while.

Is all you are looking at, but ALL servers that have a crown with playerRights 3 actually don’t write 3 to the client. DUR? Just gtfo, and stop acting smart.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!

item.title: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!
item.dc:creator: @pkkid pkkid
item.description:
@pkkid wrote:

Do you need to remove the old icon codes?
Like:else if (s.startsWith("modicon2")) { try { Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Files/Spirts/MODICONS 2.png"); anInt1440 = 15; anInt1441 = 20; anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441]; PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440); pixelgrabber.grabPixels(); System.out.println("loading custom spirts part 1"); } catch (Exception exception) { System.out.println(((Object) (exception))); } }

Read full topic

item.title: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!
item.dc:creator: @Diamond_Pk Diamond Pk
item.description:
@Diamond_Pk wrote:

Get your image you want to show on the server beside your name, then paste it into .cache/files/spirts well if you dont have the folders be sure to add them… Well then you are pasting your crown into the right folder you have to be sure that it has to be named admin.PNG if you want to fix a admin icon… and if it is mod icon you wanna add well name it mod.PNG…

If you dont paste the images into .cache/files/spirts it wont work… well here is the code you have to paste into Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java…

Download for all crowns http://uppit.com/v/I6S1700Y

Owner Code:

[code]else if (s.startsWith(“owner”))
{
try
{
anInt1440 = 25;
anInt1441 = 16;
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./cache/Files/Spirts/owner.PNG");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]

Hope You Enjoyed My Bad Tut.

item.source: How To Add Your Own Custom Crowns!
